document.docAuthor: Mcpherson, J. E. & Bundy, C. Scott
document.masterDocTitle: Identification of Nymphal Instars of Mecidea major Sailer and Mecidea minor Ruckes (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Pentatomidae: Mecideini) fromtheSouthwestern and Central United States

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Identification of Nymphal Instars of Mecidea major Sailer and Mecidea minor Ruckes (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Pentatomidae: Mecideini) fromtheSouthwestern and Central United States

mods:name.mods:affiliation: Department of Zoology, Southern Illinois University, Carbondale IL 62901, USA
Department of Entomology, Plant Pathology, and Weed Science, New Mexico State University, Las Cruces, NM, USA cbundy @ nmsu. edu, https: // orcid. org / 0000 - 0003 - 0385 - 6763

paragraph.emphasis:
Key to Nymphal Instars of
Mecidea major
and
M . minor
1

paragraph.keyLead: 1 Tylus longer than juga; nota without distinct dorsal submedial and sublateral longitudinal stripes; posterior margin of mesonotum almost straight, weakly to not extended posteriorly ( Figs. 5 and 12 ); thoracic pleura brown, without stripes ( Figs. 19 and 24 ); length less than 1.20........................................................................... first instar2

- Tylus longer to shorter than juga; nota with distinct submedial and sublateral longitudinal stripes; posterior margin of mesonotum moderately to strongly extended posteriorly (e.g., Figs. 6–7 , 13–14 ); thoracic pleura usually with one to two longitudinal stripes, one dorsal, one ventral ( Figs. 20–23 , 25–28 ); length more than 1.70....................................... 2

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1–4.
Oebalus pugnax
nymphs (dorsal view). 1. Second instar. 2. Third instar. 3. Fourth instar. 4. Fifth instar. Scale bars = 1 mm.

FIGURES 5–7.
Mecidea major
nymphs (dorsal view). 5. First instar. 6. Second instar. 7. Third instar. Scale bars = 0.5 mm. (From Bundy & McPherson 2018 ).

FIGURES 8–11.
Mecidea major
nymphs (dorsal view). 8. Fourth instar, light form. 9. Fourth instar, dark form. 10. Fifth instar, light form. 11. Fifth instar, dark form. Scale bars = 0.5 mm. (From Bundy & McPherson 2018 ).

FIGURES 12–14.
Mecidea minor
nymphs (dorsal view). 12. First instar. 13. Second instar. 14. Third instar. Scale bars = 0.5 mm. (From Bundy & McPherson 2011 ).

FIGURES 15–18.
Mecidea minor
nymphs (dorsal view). 15. Fourth instar, light form. 16. Fourth instar, dark form. 17. Fifth instar, light form. 18. Fifth instar, dark form. Scale bars = 0.5 mm. (From Bundy & McPherson 2011 ).

FIGURES 19–23.
Mecidea major
nymphs (ventrolateral view). 19. First instar. 20. Second instar. 21. Third instar. 22. Fourth instar. 23. Fifth instar. Arrow indicates position of pleural longitudinal stripe. Scale bars = 1.0 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: 1 Length was measured from apices of tylus and juga to apex of abdomen (two measurements); width across mesonotum and abdominal segments 3–4, whichever was widest (both measurements shown).

2 First instars of
M. major
and
M. minor
cannot be distinguished easily using morphological characters.
